qas.question: How large is the metropolitan area of Paris?
In what year was Paris' last annexation of outlying territories?
In what year were Bois de Boulogne and Bois de Vincennes annexed?

context: Excluding the outlying parks of Bois de Boulogne and Bois de Vincennes, Paris covers an oval measuring about 87 km2 (34 sq mi) in area, enclosed by the 35 km (22 mi) ring road, the <a0_0>Boulevard Périphérique<a0_0/>. The city's last major annexation of outlying territories in <a2_0>1860<a2_0/> not only gave it its modern form but also created the <a3_0>20<a3_0/> clockwise-spiralling arrondissements (municipal boroughs). From the 1860 area of 78 km2 (30 sq mi), the city limits were expanded marginally to 86.9 km2 (33.6 sq mi) in the 1920s. In <a4_0>1929<a4_0/>, the Bois de Boulogne and Bois de Vincennes forest parks were officially annexed to the city, bringing its area to about 105 km2 (41 sq mi). The metropolitan area of the city is <a1_0>2,300 km2<a1_0/> (890 sq mi).
